H0.text: Water changes phase as it releases heat to the environment when puddles on a sidewalk evaporate because the Sun heats the water.

H1.text: Water boils as it absorbs energy from the sidewalk when water puddles on a sidewalk evaporate because the Sun heats the water.

H2.text: Water becomes a gas as it absorbs energy from the Sun when water puddles on a sidewalk evaporate because the Sun heats the water.

H3.text: Water evaporates as its thermal energy is transferred to the air when the Sun heats puddles on a sidewalk.

A4.text: Evaporation is an endothermic process, since heat is absorbed during evaporation.

A5.text: The sun (solar energy) drives evaporation of water from oceans, lakes, moisture in the soil, and other sources of water.
